column4: I searched Google for this, but didnt find exactly what I was looking for.I have a hardrive with XP and on and I'm getting another drive soon. And want to tripple boot, so one drive has XP and the other drive has two distros. Anyone know of a comprehensize guide of doing so?
really easy with grub.  in fact most decent installers these days will detect all your other bootable OS's
you make partitions.  using a partition editor like qtparted.
google for "system rescue cd", it has qtparted
